entry.title: ChefConf Preview
entry.content:
Watch now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Brian Scott twitter, github, blog
  • Bridget Kromhout twitter, github
  • Christine Draper twitter, github, blog, website
  • Jamesha Fisher twitter
  • Jeff LaPlante
  • Jennifer Burke twitter
  • Jennifer Davis twitter, github
  • Jessica DeVita twitter
  • Jon Cowie twitter, github
  • Karolin Beck twitter
  • Matt Wrock twitter
  • Mukta Aphale github, twitter, TechLinguist
  • Harold “Waldo” Grunenwald twitter, github
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef Conf 2015: Game On! March 31 - April 2 at the Santa Clara Convention Center in Santa Clara, CA.

Day 1: Tuesday, March 31st

  • Workshop - Introduction to Chef: Managing Linux
    • Diversity Scholarship
    • Diversity in the Chef Community
  • Chef Community Summit
    • Open Space Event
  • Welcome Reception Beverages & Snacks provided.
    • 5:30pm - 7:00pm in the Exhibit Hall
  • Chef Meetup @ Ooyala
    • Ooyala

Day 2: Wednesday, April 1st

  • 5K Run
  • Power Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center’s Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Nathen Harvey
    • Barry Crist and Justin Arbukle
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 1)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 2)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 3)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 4)
    • Surprise Speaker!!
  • Track Sessions
    • Brian Scott and Jeff LaPlante: Disney DevOps: Automating the Enterprise with Supermarket, Containers and BI
    • Bridget Kromhout: Cooking Up Drama
    • Jamesha Fisher: Securing the Heart of Automated Infrastructure
    • Matt Wrock: Entering the Chef Ecosystem from a Windows Background
  • Panel: Have Your Bets On Open Paid Off? with Cade Metz
  • Sponsors’ Happy Hour
  • After Party at Levi’s Stadium
  • Game Night

Day 3: Thursday, April 2nd

  • Gentle and Slow Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center’s Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Adam Jacob
    • Jez Humble
    • Nicole Forsgren
  • Track Sessions
    • Jessica DeVita: Automate What You Can, Document What You Can’t and Have the Wisdom to Know the Difference
    • Christine Draper: Serve Meals, Not Ingredients
    • Jon Cowie: [Workflow Design: Extracting Signal from the Noise
    • Harold “Waldo” Grunenwald: Chef Retrospective
    • Mukta Aphale: Baking Docker Using Chef

Other Talks and Information

  • POSHChef
  • PowerShell from the Group Up
  • Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Veteran Chefs
  • Networking SDD: Same Stuff, Different Department

  • Managing Databases with Chef

  • Twitter list of all ChefConf Speakers

  • Awesome Chef Awards

  • Friday Hack Day
    • Mountain View
  • Chef as a Welcoming Community
    • Reaching Out to Community Newbies (Upcoming Program!)
  • Thursday Lightning Talks: DevLOLOps - How To Automate Your DevOps Hilarity
  • Thank You Jennifer Burke!!

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef Software, Inc..

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Configuration Management Camp
entry.content:
A wrap-up of Configuration Management Camp 2015 recorded live at the end of the conference.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio

Panel

  • Kara Sowles - twitter
  • Gareth Rushgrove - twitter
  • James Shubin - twitter
  • Andrew Clay Shafer - twitter
  • Kris Buytaert - twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

  • Panel Intros
  • The Puppet Podcast
  • The Genesis of ConfigManagementCamp
  • 8 Track Conference in Gent, Belgium from February 2-3 2015
  • FOSDEM Conference
  • Differences between this year’s conference and last year’s
  • Life of a Community Manager
  • FOSDEM vs ConfigManagementCamp
  • Monitorama
  • Containerization
  • Virtualization
  • Widespread Maturity
  • Building Images in Docker
  • Tools and Solving Higher Level Problems
  • Controversial Topics:
    • Config management is a solved problem.
    • Talks responding to talks.
    • The future of configuration management.
    • Distributed systems and ways to kill central orchestration.
    • Orchestration is a smell.
    • Dev and Ops hate each other.
  • Chef in Europe
  • Getting good as being a distributed community => Should we do a North American ConfigManagementCamp??
  • Does geography and culture impact adoption?
  • Honesty, sharing, and vulnerability
  • Keep it niche; keep pushing forward W* here does ZooKeeper fit in?
  • Technology Transition

Download

  • Audio

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Complexity Theory and Cynefin
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss Complexity Theory and Cynefin. This twitter thread is the inspiration for this show.

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • Dave Zwieback twitter, blog, github
  • Courtney Nash twitter, github
  • Ben Rockwood twitter, blog, github
  • Dave Snowden twitter, blog

Outline

Chef News

  • Upcoming Chef Training - Register with code FOODFIGHT to save 10%
    • Bangalore - Fundamentals
    • San Francisco - Fundamentals
    • Bangalore - Intermediate
    • London - Intermediate with Nathen! - Feb 5-6
    • NYC - Intermediate
    • NYC - Fundamentals
    • Seattle / Windows
    • San Francisco - Intermediate
    • London - Fundamentals
    • Atlanta - Intermediate
    • Atlanta - Fundamentals
    • Minneapolis - Fundamentals
    • Minneapolis - Intermediate
    • Online
      • Feb 11-13
      • Feb 18-20
      • Feb 24-26
  • Upcoming Conferences & Events
    • FOSDEM
    • Configuration Management Camp
    • Piedmont Triad DevOps Inaugural Meetup
    • Chef Users London Meetup with Nathen! - Feb 4
    • Developer Week San Francisco
    • The Lean Enterprise: Book Signing and Q&A with Jez Humble at the AWS Startup Loft in San Francisco
  • ChefConf
    • March 31 - Community Summit & Training Workshops
    • April 1 & 2 - Keynotes, session tracks, etc.
    • Schedule - Still a bit of a work in progress
    • Register with code FOODFIGHT to save 10%

Show Notes

  • This twitter thread is the inspiration for this show.
  • The HBR Article: David J. Snowden and Mary E. Boone: A Leader’s Framework for Decision Making
  • Cynefin
  • [Ben Rockwood’s Keynote at LISA: The DevOps Transformation
  • Dave Snowden: Beyond Manufacturing Metaphors: Thinking Anew, Acting Anew
  • Complexity Defined: The Complexity Theory
    • Systems
      • Ordered
      • Obvious
      • Complicated
      • Chaotic
  • How do we know which domain (obvious/complicated/complex/chaotic) we’re in, and how does that impact how we might act?
  • Disorder
  • Emergent Coherence
  • Constraints
    • Scientific Management of Systems
  • Six Sigma
  • Consensus and Ritual Decent
  • Efficiency and Effectiveness
  • Requisite Diversity
  • Conceptual Blending
  • Cognitive Nueroscience
  • Applying the theory to day to day activities and teams
  • How do these ideas relate to DevOps, IT Operations, Agile, LEAN, ITIL, etc.?
    • Is the understanding of complex, adaptive systems one of the reasons for the emergence of DevOps?
    • Is DevOps itself a complex, adaptive system (including its pratitioners)?
    • Why manufacturing metaphors may not work in describing IT Operations?
  • Safety => Breaking the Rules, Compliance
  • Testing, Anticipatory Awareness
  • Training

Picks

Mike

  • Snow and the weather

Dave Zwieback

  • Awesome Postmortems Workshop - February 12, 2015, NYC.

Courtney

  • @EskoKilpi

Ben

  • anCnoc 12
  • Go Beyond Cynefin
  • Read Henry Ford’s work and learn, learn, learn!

Dave Snowden

  • Ritual Dissent
  • Penderyn

Nathen

  • St. Baldrick’s Foundation - My son’s St. Baldrick’s team

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.content:
Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Matt Ray github, twitter, irc: mattray, blog
  • Mike Fiedler github, twitter, blog
  • John Vincent, aka Lusis twitter, github
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter

Outline

  • How The Food Fight Show got started
  • Favorite Episodes:
    • Testing in Practice
    • Back to the Kernel With Greg Kroah-Hartman
    • TESTALLTHETHINGS: Testing Infrastructure with Jim Hopp, Stephen Nelson-Smith, and Andrew Crump
    • Live Post-Mortem With David Zwieback, John Allspaw, and Mike Rembetsy
    • Adrian Cockcroft Episode => Netflix OSS
    • Steven Murawski Episode => Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins
    • Nordstrom Episode => Windows Roundtable
    • Live Episodes
    • LWRPs
    • Application Deployment
    • Continuous Delivery
  • What has gotten better in the DevOps community since the show started?
    • Diversity
    • The rise of “Small Town” DevOps Days
  • The DevOps Debate
    • “DevOps” across the industry
    • WHAT DOES “DEVOPS” MEAN?!?!?!
    • Improving knowledge
    • Continuous improvement: The new “CI”
    • Gene Kim (Twitter)
  • Grievances
    • Priveledge, Flexibility, & Time
    • The passing of James Golick, Ezra Zygmuntowicz, and Jim Weirich
    • Linux is becoming dominant
    • OpenStack
    • “Working Code Builds Consensus” – Jesse Robins
    • Neglecting the humanity: We are PEOPLE too!
    • No managers?

Picks

Brandon

  • Jon Cowie: Remote Working: 3 Year Retrospective

Nathen

  • Start
    • scheduling more regular Food Fight Show episodes
    • Have a Book Club series: POODR: Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby: An Agile Primer by Sandi Metz.
  • Stop
    • having panels that are all white men.
  • Continue
    • Having discussions about technology.
    • doing Chef-specific episodes.

Matt

  • SoftwareDefinedTalk
  • The Everything Store: Jeff Bezos and the Age of Amazon
  • Your Local Library

John

  • Logitech Wireless Solar Keyboard K750

Mike

  • Ready Player One by Ernest Cline

Bryan

  • The Click Library from Python
  • airline
  • Java 8
  • Nathen Harvey

Outline

  • LinkedIn
  • Apache Kafka
    • @apachekafka
  • Kafka Defined: Kafka is a distributed, partitioned, replicated commit log service. It provides the functionality of a messaging system, but with a unique design.
    • Getting Started: Introduction
    • FAQ
    • Documentation
    • Mailing Lists
    • irc.freenode.net/#apache-kafka

    • “Hosted Open Source”
    • Amazon Kinesis
    • Opportunity & Funding

  • A challenge to everyone involved in organising tech events: how can we leverage our many social gatherings for the greater social good? For example, consider the 1:1:1 model in the context of tech events, or even something as simple as donating some of the profits to charity (perhaps to build a well).

entry.title: Even MOAR Windows
entry.content:
• Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Audio

Panel

  • Bryan Berry github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere
  • Steven Murawski github, twitter, blog
  • Adam Edwards github
  • Daniel Mitchell
  • Hans

Outline

  • How do I figure out how parameterize an MSI install?
  • Key windows-specific resources you should know about: registry_key, env
  • Creating and managing Windows services
    • What is a windows service?
    • Tools, automating creation of services?
    • nssm.cc, procrun
    • How does a service resource relate to Windows services?
    • Explaining “Get-Service”, “Start-Service”, “Stop-Service”
  • If run chef under the SYSTEM user and sometimes I get weird errors that I can’t reproduce while logged in ANSWER: psexec -s some_command.exe
  • What is the pstools suite? Which commands are of particular interest: ANSWER: All of them.
  • Servercore - Can I run Powershell ISE or another editor with server core? Otherwise, how do I edit files?
  • Servercore gotchas
  • Building windows amis for EC2
    • Put code to generate SSL certificate in userdata
    • Connect to instance over winrm
    • Packer is your friend
  • There is a good example in the Ansible codebase, example from knife bootstrap?
  • Is using GNUWIN32 utilities on windows, a bad idea? YES Bryan: less can’t read unicode files on win2k12, ls has bizarre issues
  • remote-file editing w/ ISE coming
  • Powershell basics: Do both stdout and stderr return objects? There are actually 7, count ‘em 7 streams
  • What is the equivalent of (strace)[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strace] in Windows?

entry.title: Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins
entry.content:
Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Steven Murawski - github, twitter, blog
  • Matt Stratton - github, twitter
  • Stephen Nelson-Smith - twitter, irc: cope, blog
  • Nathen Harvey - github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog
  • Bryan Berry - github, twitter, irc: bryanwb, blog: devopsanywhere

Outline

Chef News

  • Chef Community Summit Wiki

Upcoming Events

Chef Week London - Intermediate Training with Mandi Walls, Chef Community Summit London, and a Chef Hack Day. October 13-17, 2014. Use code CHEFWEEK to save!

  • Chef Users London Meetup - October 9
  • Chef Community Summit London - October 15 & 16 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%, CHEFWEEK saves more ;)
  • Erlang Camp - October 10 & 11 in Austin, Texas
  • Silicon Valley Code Camp - October 11 in Los Altos Hills, California
  • Houston Texas DevOps – October 14 - JJ Asghar will be presenting “Infrastructur­e as Code”
  • Docker Santa Clara Meetup - October 15 - Tom Duffield will be presenting “Managing Docker Containers”
  • CloudDevelop - October 17 in Columbus, Ohio - Julian Dunn will be presenting “Automating That Other OS: Cooking With Chef on Windows”
  • London Hack Day - October 17
  • All Things Open - October 22-23 in Raleigh, North Carolina - Nathen Harvey will present “Introduction to Infrastructure as Code & Automation / Introduction to Chef”
  • Rakuten Technology Conference - October 25 in Japan - Michael Ducy will be talking about Changing the Behavior of IT.
  • T-DOSE - October 25 & 26 in The Netherlands
  • IC3 - October 27-28 in San Francisco - George Miranda and a few other Chefs will be around. George will be presenting “Successful Patterns of DevOps – Your To-Do List”
  • QCon San Francisco - November 3-7 in San Francisco - Franklin Webber will be leading an Intro to Chef tutorial on the 7th.

  • LISA - LISA returns to Seattle (November 9-14) this year. Be sure to swing by and check out talks and tutorials from Jennifer Davis, Steven Murawski, Mandi Walls, Nathen Harvey, and more!

  • DevOpsDays

    • Berlin - October 23 & 24
    • Belgium - October 27 & 28 - Five year anniversary
    • Vancouver - November 14 & 15

Upcoming Chef Training

Use discount code FOODFIGHT to save 10% off upcoming Chef training that’s being held in

  • London
  • Bangalore
  • Dallas
  • Atlanta
  • San Francisco
  • Washington, DC

There are also a number of classes being offered online.

Show Notes

  • API-driven, not document- or configuration file-driven
  • Use Powershell to drive the API
  • Common Engineering Criteria
    • All management functionality must be exposed to Powershell
  • Server 2012 has 2400+ Powershell commands covering Windows administration and functionality
  • Powershell
    • Command line
    • Remote shell
    • Powershell ISE - Integrated Scripting Editor
      • ISESteriods
    • Embedded
  • Command line parsing, pipeline semantics, debugging, etc.
  • Powershell equalivent of apt-get
    • chocolatey - choco install emacs … choco install vim
      • uses NuGet packages
    • OneGet is Microsoft’s unified interface to package management systems - available in Poweshell 5
    • PsGet
  • PSReadline
  • Pester - Powershell BDD style testing framework
    • busser-pester
  • Text Editors
    • NOT notepad
    • Powershell ISE - if nothing else is there
    • Sublime Text
    • Atom
    • emacs, of course
  • Basic resources that Chef users should know about
    • Package-Service-Template paradigm doesn’t really work for Windows
    • Powershell and DSC
    • PowerShellDSC converts the document-oriented calls of Chef to API-oriented calls of Windows
    • test target resource, set target resource, get target resource
    • Identifying which registry keys have changed is painful
    • Inspect MSIs with Orca.aspx)
    • Windows Cookbook
  • Debugging Powershell is painful
    • Windows Management Framework 5 - might go back as far as 2008 R2.
    • Powershell 5 has many updates and enhancements for debugging
  • Test Kitchen at ChefSummit
  • Escaping from Powershell and using command.exe escaping - knife winrm --% ....
  • Adam Edwards, PowerChef - Enhanced PowerShell Integration for Chef Recipes from #ChefConf 2014
  • royalTSX
  • WinRS
  • WinRM

Picks

Stephen
  • The Inner Game of Tennis: The Classic Guide to the Mental Side of Peak Performance by W. Timothy Gallwey
  • The Unfettered Mind: Writings of the Zen Master to the Sword Master by Takuan Soho
  • Shinken
Matt
  • BoJack Horseman
  • Scott Hanselman’s 2014 Ultimate Developer and Power Users Tool List for Windows
Steven
  • Cornered Cat
  • Windows Management Framework 5.0
Nathen
  • Customizing Chef by Jon Cowie
  • Open Spaces
Bryan
  • China History Podcast
  • Sinica Podcast
  • Dependency Walker
  • Sauce Labs

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef.

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

  • Chef Community Summit London - October 15 & 16 - FOODFIGHT saves 10%

  • DevOpsDays Chicago - October 7 & 8 - The Food Fight Show is a Media Sponsor code FOODFIGHT10 will save you 10% off!

  • Fossetcon - September 11 - 13
  • Velocity New York - September 15-17
  • PowerShell DSC at Chef-NYC Meetup - September 17
  • Chef Analytics Webinar - September 17
  • Beyond the Code - September 19 in Ottawa Canada

  • PowerShell Summit EU - September 29 through October 1 in Amsterdam, The Netherlands

  • DevOpsDays

    • Toronto - September 12 & 13
    • New York City - September 19
    • Warsaw - September 25 & 26
    • Tel Aviv - September 29 & 30
    • Berlin - October 23 & 24
    • Belgium - October 27 & 28 - Five year anniversary
    • Vancouver - November 14 & 15

Upcoming Chef Training

Use discount code FOODFIGHT to save 10% off upcoming Chef training that’s being held in

  • Austin
  • Bangalore
  • Chennai
  • Denver
  • Phoenix
  • Raleigh
  • San Francisco
  • Seattle

There are also a number of classes being offered online.

Show Notes

Here’s a brief outline of some of the things we discussed:

  • Intro to ChefDK
    • The Chef Development Kit (ChefDK)
    • What’s in the box?
      • Berkshelf 3.0
      • Test Kitchen
      • ChefSpec
      • Foodcritic
      • All the Chef tools you’d usually install on a workstation: knife, ohai, chef-client, chef-zero
      • New command-line tool called chef
  • Working with Ruby Gemfiles
    • Simplifying the tool chain
  • Why is it called “Chef”?
  • What does typing Chef actually do?
  • Using ChefDK
    • Using the chef command
      • verify
      • Some glue commands - exec, gem, and shell-init
  • Chef for Beginners and New Users
  • The chef generate Command
    • What does it do?
    • How does it work?
    • generate
      • coobkook
      • recipe
      • attribute
      • template
      • file
      • lwrp
      • app
  • The Future of ChefDK
    • Implementing a Test Command in ChefDK
    • Policyfile.rb
    • Release Cycle, Upgrade Paths, etc. Expectancy
    • ChefDK and Windows/Cross Platform Compatability
      • Chef Docs Repo: https://github.com/opscode/chef-docs
  • Supported operating systems - As of version 0.2.1 the following Operating Systems are supported:
    • Mac OS X 10.8, 10.9
    • Windows 7, 8, 8.1 & Server 2008 R2, 2012, 2012 R2
    • Ubuntu Linux 12.04, 13.10
    • Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  • Upcoming: The Policy File

Commands to install ChefDK from command line: * Install latest released version - curl -L https://www.getchef.com/chef/install.sh | sudo bash -s -- -P chefdk * Install nightly build - curl -L https://www.getchef.com/chef/install.sh | sudo bash -s -- -P chefdk -n

Jon

Jonathan

    • Install latest released version - curl -L https://www.getchef.com/chef/install.sh | sudo bash -s -- -P chefdk
    • Install nightly build - curl -L https://www.getchef.com/chef/install.sh | sudo bash -s -- -P chefdk -n

  • Austin
  • Bangalore
  • Chennai
  • Denver
  • Phoenix
  • Raleigh
  • San Francisco
  • Seattle

There are also a number of classes being offered online.

Show Notes

Here’s a brief outline of some of the things we’d like to discuss. Add your ideas to the show notes.

  • kitchen.ci
    • What is Test Kitchen?
    • Why Test Kitchen?
    • Walk us through a .kitchen.yml file
    • How does one get started with Test Kitchen?
    • How does one extend Test Kitchen?
    • Terms
      • driver
      • provisioner
      • platforms
      • suites
      • bussers; and the magic behind them
  • How are the Chef Development Kit and Test Kitchen related?
  • Interesting use cases for test-kitchen. Leveraging drivers to do development in the cloud when local machine restrictions won’t allow for vagrant/vmware.
  • Does TK have any support for evaluating idempotence and/or run performance?
    • Testing Idempotence for Infrastructure as Code
  • Test Kitchen & Windows Guest? Uhmmm is that possible?
  • How do bussers work? Are they run from the host machine or on the machine under test?
  • Chef Cookbook Development Workflow RFC

Picks

Fletcher

  • ChefSpec
  • The Goal, especially the audio book version
  • Walking (the exercise, you know, get up from your desk)

JJ

  • Sean O’Meara: Cookbook Unit and Acceptance Testing
  • The Game of Thrones board game
  • Cold Brew Coffee

Jonathan

  • The Wirecutter
  • CircleCI
  • Tom Duffield’s Chef-Container Talk

Joshua

  • RFC - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Chef Issue - Homebrew As OS X Default Package Provider
  • Homebrew Cask
  • The Complete Joy of Homebrewing
  • Chef reporting API and the knife-reporting gem

Salim

  • Moonwalking with Einstein

Scott

  • Little sumpin’ from Lagunitas

Mike

  • Blue Apron

Nathen

  • Chef Developers’ IRC Meetings
  • Taking a proper vacation: leave your phone and computer at home.
  • Not being an asshole on social media or anywhere else, for that matter.
